content.description:
Question refers to the excerpt below. 

“[T]his administration is motivated by a political philosophy that sees the greatness of America in you, her people, and in your families, churches, neighborhoods, communities—the institutions that foster and nourish values like concern for others and respect for the rule of law under God.

“Now, I don’t have to tell you that this puts us in opposition to . . . a prevailing attitude of many who have turned to a modern-day secularism, discarding the tried and time-tested values upon which our very civilization is based. . . . And while they proclaim that they’re freeing us from superstitions of the past, they’ve taken upon themselves the job of superintending us by government rule.”

President Ronald Reagan, speech to the National Association of Evangelicals, 1983
content.question: The excerpt most directly reflects which of the following trends of the 1980s?

choices.label: The continued growth of the influence of liberal political ideas
The religious diversity of the Republican Party’s supporters
The increasing public belief in the federal government’s positive influence on society
The expanding political participation of Christian groups

content.answer: The expanding political participation of Christian groups
